summary: The Holocaust Education and Antisemitism Lessons Act mandates a study by the Director of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum on Holocaust education efforts in US states, local educational agencies, and public elementary and secondary schools. The study will examine existing curricula, standards, resources, and educational outcomes, including students' understanding of antisemitism and hate. A report with findings and recommendations will be submitted to Congress. The bill defines key terms like "Holocaust education" and references relevant federal laws.
